thread.title: Two dead after car crashed into Auschwitz tour bus with Brits on board
thread.title_full: Two dead after car crashed into Auschwitz tour bus with Brits on board

author: adevlin
title: Two dead after car crashed into Auschwitz tour bus with Brits on board
text:
DEATH CAMP BUS SMASH Two dead after car crashed into Auschwitz tour bus with Brits on board 
There were 54 people caught up in the crash, which included tourists from England, Italy and Germany By AMANDA DEVLIN Comments AN Auschwitz tour bus has crashed with Brits on board killing two and injuring another. 
A Citroen car driver was travelling on the motorway in the town of Zagorz, southern Poland when it lost control and collided into the tour bus. 
The incident happened on Saturday and it is believed the coach was on the way back from a visit to Nazi death camp Auschwitz. 
The driver and passenger of the car died in the collision and one passenger of the coach, the 23-year-old tour guide, was seriously injured and taken to hospital in nearby Krakow. 
The tour bus carrying 54 people had tourists from England, Italy and Germany on board. 
The road had to be closed for five hours after the accident. 
The victims’ names were not mentioned in reports. 
Fireman Marcin Kleczek said: “Nine fire brigades were sent to the place of the accident. 
“The participant of the crash was a tour coach going from Auschwitz to Krakow and the car.” 
Police say investigations are ongoing. 
Auschwitz was a network of German Nazi concentration camps and extermination camps built and operated by the Third Reich in Polish areas annexed by Nazi Germany during World War II. 
It consisted of Auschwitz I – the original camp, Auschwitz II-Birkenau – a concentration and extermination camp, and Auschwitz III–Monowitz – a labour camp. 
An estimated 1.3 million people were sent to the camp, of whom at least 1.1 million died.
